pli-tv-bi-vb-pc84:0.2: The nuns’ rules and their analysis
pli-tv-bi-vb-pc84:0.3: The chapter on offenses entailing confession
pli-tv-bi-vb-pc84:0.4: The sub-chapter on sunshades and sandals
pli-tv-bi-vb-pc84:0.5: 84. The training rule on sunshades and sandals
pli-tv-bi-vb-pc84:1.1.1: At one time when the Buddha was staying at Sāvatthī in Anāthapiṇḍika’s Monastery,
pli-tv-bi-vb-pc84:1.1.2: the nuns from the group of six used sunshades and sandals.
pli-tv-bi-vb-pc84:1.1.4: “How can nuns use sunshades and sandals? They are just like householders who indulge in worldly pleasures!”
pli-tv-bi-vb-pc84:1.1.5: The nuns heard the complaints of those people.
pli-tv-bi-vb-pc84:1.1.6: The nuns of few desires complained and criticized them,
pli-tv-bi-vb-pc84:1.1.7: “How can the nuns from the group of six use sunshades and sandals?” …
pli-tv-bi-vb-pc84:1.1.8: “Is it true, monks, that those nuns do this?”
pli-tv-bi-vb-pc84:1.1.11: “… How can the nuns from the group of six do this?
pli-tv-bi-vb-pc84:1.1.12: This won’t give rise to confidence in those without it …
pli-tv-bi-vb-pc84:1.1.13: And, monks, the nuns should recite this training rule like this:
pli-tv-bi-vb-pc84:1.1.14.1: ‘If a nun uses a sunshade and sandals, she commits an offense entailing confession.’”
pli-tv-bi-vb-pc84:1.1.15: In this way the Buddha laid down this training rule for the nuns.
pli-tv-bi-vb-pc84:1.2.1: Soon afterwards there was a sick nun
pli-tv-bi-vb-pc84:1.2.2: who was not comfortable without sandals and a sunshade. …
pli-tv-bi-vb-pc84:1.2.3: They told the Buddha. The Buddha then had the Sangha gathered and addressed the monks:
pli-tv-bi-vb-pc84:1.2.4: “Monks, I allow a sick nun to use a sunshade and sandals.
pli-tv-bi-vb-pc84:1.2.5: And so, monks, the nuns should recite this training rule like this:
pli-tv-bi-vb-pc84:1.2.6.1: ‘If a nun who is not sick uses a sunshade and sandals, she commits an offense entailing confession.’”
pli-tv-bi-vb-pc84:2.1.4: … The nun who has been given the full ordination in unanimity by both Sanghas through a legal procedure consisting of one motion and three announcements that is irreversible and fit to stand—this sort of nun is meant in this case.
pli-tv-bi-vb-pc84:2.1.6: who is comfortable without a sunshade and sandals.
pli-tv-bi-vb-pc84:2.1.8: who is not comfortable without a sunshade and sandals.
pli-tv-bi-vb-pc84:2.1.10: there are three kinds of sunshade: the white sunshade, the reed sunshade, the leaf sunshade. They are bound at the rim and bound at the ribs.
pli-tv-bi-vb-pc84:2.1.12: if she uses it even once, she commits an offense entailing confession.
pli-tv-bi-vb-pc84:2.2.1: If she is not sick, and she does not perceive herself as sick, and she uses a sunshade and sandals, she commits an offense entailing confession.
pli-tv-bi-vb-pc84:2.2.2: If she is not sick, but she is unsure of it, and she uses a sunshade and sandals, she commits an offense entailing confession.
pli-tv-bi-vb-pc84:2.2.3: If she is not sick, but she perceives herself as sick, and she uses a sunshade and sandals, she commits an offense entailing confession.
pli-tv-bi-vb-pc84:2.2.4: If she uses a sunshade, but not sandals, she commits an offense of wrong conduct.
pli-tv-bi-vb-pc84:2.2.5: If she uses sandals, but not a sunshade, she commits an offense of wrong conduct.
pli-tv-bi-vb-pc84:2.2.6: If she is sick, but she does not perceive herself as sick, she commits an offense of wrong conduct.
pli-tv-bi-vb-pc84:2.2.7: If she is sick, but she is unsure of it, she commits an offense of wrong conduct.
pli-tv-bi-vb-pc84:2.2.8: If she is sick, and she perceives herself as sick, there is no offense.
pli-tv-bi-vb-pc84:2.3.3: if she uses them in a monastery or in the vicinity of a monastery;
pli-tv-bi-vb-pc84:2.3.6: if she is the first offender.
pli-tv-bi-vb-pc84:2.3.7: The first training rule is finished.
